turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Tawny-throated leaftosser.
turn.1: What is the range of the Tawny-throated leaftosser?
turn.2: Incertae sedis: The tawny-throated leaftosser ranges from southern Mexico through Central America into Colombia, and from there south to the Peruvian Andes as well as southeast to the Amazon Basin, with an isolated population in the Atlantic Forest of Brazil.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The species is largely absent from Venezuela and is patchily distributed across most of its range, particularly Central America.
turn.5: What is the habitat of the species?
turn.6: Its natural habitats are tropical moist lowland forests and tropical moist montane evergreen forests.
turn.7: Does the species occur in any other places?
turn.8: It prefers hilly terrain, occurring mainly between 700 and 2,200 m ASL in Central America, and from near sea level to 1,500 m and locally to 2,000 m ASL in South America.
turn.10: The species lives on the ground, where it feeds on invertebrates found by flicking through leaf litter, digging in moist soil or in rotting wood, often using the tail to anchor itself; the tips of the rectrices become abraded by this behavior and before moult often just the resilient feather shafts remain.
turn.11: What else can you tell me about the species?
turn.12: Tawny-throated leaftossers are encountered singly or in pairs; they may be attracted by recordings of their alarm calls.
